oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Randall B. Vandervall
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Etching of Randall Bartholomew Vandervall, prominent Baptist minister and educator.

Randall Bartholomew Vandavall was born a slave on March 23, 1832 at Neely's Bend, near Nashville. In 1862 he was elected pastor of the "African mission" of the Spring Street Baptist Church. In 1864, he and others were instrumental in the opening of the Roger Williams University, where he served as a trustee. In 1866, he formed the Second Colored Baptist Church. . He served on the Negro Committee of the Tennessee Centenial in 1897. He died in Nashville in 1898.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Simmons, William J., 1849-1890
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Men of Mark: Eminent, Progressive and Rising
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans - Biography
